snippet: Both Montclair’s Israel Crane House and Red Bank’s T. Thomas Fortune House are on the National Register of Historic Places and both are civil rights landmarks. But while the Crane House is thriving, the Fortune House is threatened with...
abstract: Israel Crane House and Historic YWCA in Montclair, NJ, and T Thomas Fortune House in Red Bank, NJ, two sites with historic significance for black community, are both on National Register of Historic places; while Israel Crane House has been fully restored and is open to visitors, T Thomas Fortune House sits vacant in state of disrepair.
lead_paragraph: Both Montclair’s Israel Crane House and Red Bank’s T. Thomas Fortune House are on the National Register of Historic Places and both are civil rights landmarks. But while the Crane House is thriving, the Fortune House is threatened with demolition.

headline.print_headline: Fates Diverge for Civil Rights Landmarks
headline.main: Fates Diverge for Homes That Touched Black History
